greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of permutations satisfying -k <= p(i) - i <= r and p(i) - i not in I, i=1..n, with k=1, r=4, I={0,3}.
comment: Number of compositions (ordered partitions) of n into elements of the set {2,3,5}.
For n>=2, a(n) is number of compositions of n-2 with elements from the set {1,2,3} such that no two odd numbers appear consecutively. - _Armend Shabani_, Mar 01 2017
reference: D. H. Lehmer, Permutations with strongly restricted displacements. Combinatorial theory and its applications, II (Proc. Colloq., Balatonfured, 1969), pp. 755-770. North-Holland, Amsterdam, 1970.
link: Vladimir Baltic, On the number of certain types of strongly restricted permutations, Applicable Analysis and Discrete Mathematics Vol. 4, No 1 (2010), 119-135
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,1,1,0,1).
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[-1/(x^5 + x^3 + x^2 - 1), {x, 0, 44}], x] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 02 2017 *)
xref: Row sums of A059484. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 02 2009
results.author: _Vladimir Baltic_, Feb 17 2003
